programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: An auction in Whittier sees a buyer named Big Dave try to take it all. The guys win a cool food truck and an off-road rock crawler after some losses.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Ashley interferes with one of Karen's sales on the shop floor, a family feud breaks out. Meanwhile, a rock metal group drops by.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle search through a scrapyard and a 19th-century ghost town, and find a classic car with a famous Hollywood history.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters adopt some unusual tactics to recover from a run of bad luck, and one team goes in search of a rogue gator that has been preying on farmers' livestock.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The team is called to assist when a lorry crashes and blocks the road's most important exit. Meanwhile, Scott has a bone to pick with recovery team boss Jamie. Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The brokers come across top-secret maps and plans for the Second World War battle of Iwo Jima. Additional items include a 1967 Ford F-100 truck.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a classic 1967 Rokon Trailbreaker motorbike and a collection of rare Muhammad Ali memorabilia. They also have to decide whether a 1715 Escudo Spanish gold coin is a fake.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for interesting - but not necessarily correct - answers. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are guests Aisling Bea, Lee Mack and Jason Manford.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedians Nish Kumar and Katherine Ryan, historian Kate Williams and sports presenter Gabby Logan join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe as the comedy quiz returns. The two teams answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winning trio getting to decide the greatest-ever bearer of this week's moniker.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Following an unsuccessful gig, Josh is surprised to be asked out by a very beautiful audience member, and together with Kate and Owen sets out to determine whether there is a catch. Meanwhile, landlord Geoff faces money problems and introduces Kate to the dizzying world of building management politics. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Elis James and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The fearsome Duke of Wellington challenges Prince George to a duel. Edmund volunteers to take his place, secretly intending to have his insane Scottish cousin MacAdder fill in for him. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Fry, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The spies who worked during the American Civil War, including Elizabeth van Lew, whose effective network even smuggled out messages in hollow eggs.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the secretive Rosicrucian Order, whose members included Leonardo Da Vinci and Isaac Newton.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Tokyo Skytree, the world's tallest free-standing tower, which uses liquid springs and safety glass to withstand earthquakes and high winds.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The settings for the Trotter brothers' adventures, from their regular Peckham haunts to episodes that took them further afield.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund writes Prince George a speech to help quell growing anarchy among the masses - but is none too pleased when the dim-witted royal hires a pair of superstitious actors to teach him how to deliver it properly. Comedy, guest starring Hugh Paddick and Kenneth Connor, with Rowan Atkinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund needs to get his hands on some cash and asks the Prince Regent for a raise - only to find the brainless royal has lost all his money playing cards. To remedy the situation, the butler decides he will have to find George a bride with a large dowry and introduces him to the daughter of a wealthy industrialist. Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson and Warren Clarke, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The fearsome Duke of Wellington challenges Prince George to a duel. Edmund volunteers to take his place, secretly intending to have his insane Scottish cousin MacAdder fill in for him. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Fry, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A troubled Vietnamese student seeks Sam's advice on her arranged marriage to an older man, and shortly afterwards a fire guts the restaurant owned by the father of her husband-to-be. A man's charred body is found among the ashes and post-mortem tests prove he was murdered, giving events a sinister twist. Amanda Burton and Clare Higgins star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack takes a break from paperwork to help investigate a case alongside CID officers, only to discover his increasingly wayward son Ben may be the mastermind behind a major-league drugs operation. Yvonne's trial gets under way, and Laura Bryant begins work as a PC, while a sceptical Sheelagh kidnaps a youngster allegedly suffering from leukaemia, unwilling to believe there's anything wrong with her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A man returns home to witness an explosion at his house and sees a figure leaping from the upstairs window. Firefighter Jack Morgan joins the team.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: People are talking about Cindy around the square but can Ian deal with the dirty rumours and Mark has a gift for Adrian and Mandy to cheer them up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Return of the military drama series, starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn. The Kings Fusiliers embark on a grueling rock climbing exercise in Snowdonia.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy and Nancy impulsively decide to get married before the company leaves for Hong Kong - but she starts to have second thoughts. Starring Jerome Flynn and Holly Aird.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack takes a break from paperwork to help investigate a case alongside CID officers, only to discover his increasingly wayward son Ben may be the mastermind behind a major-league drugs operation. Yvonne's trial gets under way, and Laura Bryant begins work as a PC, while a sceptical Sheelagh kidnaps a youngster allegedly suffering from leukaemia, unwilling to believe there's anything wrong with her.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Matt tries to raise money by signing up for clinical trials after his landlord evicts him over unpaid rent, and Lola is angry when she receives a postcard from her globe-trotting daughter. Donna helps with a drugs audit, but ends up flirting with Bradley.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tina visits Australia to look for Sean - but her search leads her into the scorching heat of the Outback, where she soon realises finding him will be more difficult than anticipated. Back in England, the winter flu crisis stretches Charlie and his staff to the limit. Medical drama, starring Claire Goose, Gerald Kyd and Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Yvonne finally learns her fate, and Jack Meadows continues to build a case against son Ben, but discovers to his frustration that he can only muster enough evidence to charge a comparatively insignificant drugs courier. Smithy tells Sheelagh that Gabriel raped Kerry Young, while Gina makes a bad impression on new boss Amanda Prosser by throwing a drink over a copper from Barton Street station.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Sharon's birthday but no one is in the mood to celebrate. Michelle puts Richard in his place and tensions between Ian and Cindy reaches a head.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy is still worried about Richard's rumour mongering, and when he winds her up in the Vic she finds no one willing to come to her defence.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: When a raid on a security van goes disastrously wrong, Blue Watch race against time to free the trapped crew. Meanwhile, Nick is unsympathetic to Alexis's pleas.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Jess's skills are put to the test when poachers take advantage of Golly's absence to target the estate, so Donald tries to use his own unique methods to nip the problem in the bud. Isobel and Paul's relationship falters when she jumps to conclusions about his offer of assistance, and the appearance of a glamorous new neighbour only serves to increase the tension between them.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna tries to help new factory worker Linda Sargent, a single mother afraid she'll lose custody of her five children if it becomes known that she has Parkinson's disease. Meanwhile, Beth agonises over whether to accept the offer of a job in Holland, uncertain of how such a drastic move would affect her relationship with Tom - and paradoxically, it takes a rugby match to help her decide. Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: As the bills pile up, Tracey has to consider selling Darryl's car, while Sharon goes into the perfume business to raise some cash. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Tyler is left cold by all the kerfuffle as the family awaits the arrival of his French exchange student. He even considers getting engaged to Beth in a bid to get out of paying a return visit to France. However, the guest's eventual arrival causes a stir all round. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Amos Hames, an old friend of the trio's, reappears in the town after many years absence, arousing suspicion about the reasons for his return. Timothy Bateson guest stars in the whimsical comedy, with Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy takes Compo and Clegg on a nostalgic day out to the Keighley and Worth Valley Railway to ride on a steam train - but the trio soon interfere in matters that should not concern them. Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.sub-title: In the Blink of an Eye
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective investigates when former war photographer Peter Rooker is found shot dead. It is not long before he uncovers a trail leading from tabloid newspaper baron Eddie Price and editor Melissa Booth to an executed Bosnian family, but when he enlists his wife's help in determining the psychological history behind the murder, a fatal chain of events begins.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The death of a teenage tennis star occupies the team when it is suggested her suicide jump two years earlier was anything but. They soon find several people with motives for her murder, including her coach Nick and agent Anthony, but it seems the one with the most to benefit from the girl's demise was her great rival Fawn Brammall - a shy and subdued player who proves difficult to question. Meanwhile, Gerry wonders if he did enough to encourage his own daughter's sporting ambitions and Brian hatches a plan to turn his dog into a movie star. Detective drama, guest starring Tamzin Outhwaite and Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A boxing match ends in what appears to be an accidental tragedy, but forensic pathologist Sam Ryan's suspicions are aroused by unexplained injuries to the victim's brain. Unfortunately, she finds herself struggling to convince ex-lover DS Peter Ross that the boxing authorities are suppressing the facts. Starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford, William Armstrong and Ruth McCabe.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a mix of news and current affairs, plus health and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five friends from Dundee answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers - and new for 2020, the camera cock-ups can be broadcast in glossy high definition. Highlights this evening include crashing drones, flying dirtbikes and popping skulls.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show - A Coronavirus Special
programme.desc: Everyday life has changed dramatically with everyone facing more restrictions - and more uncertainty. Martin Lewis presents another live special in which he and Angellica Bell will be examining how coronavirus could affect finances, and taking viewers' questions on specific issues.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Policing Britain: Cops in Lockdown - Tonight
programme.desc: As lockdown continues across Britain, Tonight asks what life has been like for the police, tasked with keeping people safe during these unprecedented times. Rachel Younger follows officers from Merseyside Police to see the impact the pandemic is having on their ability to combat crime, and witnesses the particular crimes and behaviours they are encountering due to the lockdown.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: A grandad stops off outside his grandkids' window every day to mess about and make them smile. But his son-in-law, still hurting after being left by his wife, does not welcome these daily visits. David Threlfall and Eddie Marsan star in this one-off drama, which also features Eddie's children Blu and Bodhi.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: David's exoneration allows him to regain custody of his children and intensifies the investigation into Rob, Alice and Tom, leading to a critical arrest. But as damaging accusations concerning DI Hudson's relationship with David threaten to derail the case, her determination to deliver justice finally begins to unravel the mystery of who killed Tara. Drama, starring Lee Ingleby, Hermione Norris, Daniel Ryan and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: The making of the drama series, produced by Oscar-nominated writer Jeff Pope, which saw the actors working in isolation, with help from their family members.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Subjects in this episode include The Oscars, Mr Men and tennis. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: UK Hotlist Urban Chart
programme.desc: AJ King counts down the UK's 20 hottest urban beats, as compiled by Spotify. Keep it locked.

programme.title: Big Up: Cardi B

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton buys a rare Sherman tank in Ohio. However, before he sells it on it he wants to boost its authenticity and value, so consultd a tank expert for advice.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Cadillac enlists OCC and PJD to take part in a father-son build-off, while Paul Sr approaches Paul Jr with a second more peaceful settlement offer.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Documentary comparing the specifications of five of the world's largest aircraft.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe becomes a water softener technician and finds out why San Francisco's Westin hotel insists on washing money.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how everyday objects such as Marseille soap and Laguiole pocket knives, are made and how techniques have been refined over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope as the processes behind objects including cinnamon cordial and home-made rasps are revealed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Transforming the sap from rubber trees into chewing gum, how fish hooks strong enough to catch a shark are made, and the construction of Legoland models.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down through some of his most remarkable purchases, from the incredibly rare to the exquisite and quirky.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A fierce storm strikes, the crew of the Time Bandit carry out a prank on the Northwestern, and a valued fisherman leaves.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Documentary following dive crews working off the coast of South Australia, risking life and limb to harvest prized abalone.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: On Holy Island, a defunct aluminium factory must be demolished, but a giant steel crane proves tricky.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer finds an affordable Morgan to restore, but it provides mechanic Edd China with one of the biggest jobs he has ever faced.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A collector contacts Wayne Carini in the hope of selling his collection of vintage racing Cobras, with a total estimated value of $5.5million.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Florida for his first event of the motoring season, the Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they grow America's only freshwater pearls in Tennessee? Plus, a look at how the world's sharpest knives are forged.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they turn ugly root vegetables into sweet sugar? How do they make feather dusters? And, how do they make billions of balloons to keep parties popping?.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Skin and Jay seek to fill their abalone quota, but their secret hunting spot is close to where a surfer was attacked by a great white shark just a week earlier.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A new captain takes command of the Cornelia Marie, hoping to change the boat's fortunes, and the Northwestern fishes without Edgar Hansen on board for the first time.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is in the Philippines with Freddy where they find an artillery gun from the Japanese occupation in the Second World War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A scrap car gets revived for the race track, an artistic mastermind turns scrap metal into cool lighting,and an old office block is demolished close to a busy road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Victorian folly in Devon, where some ghoulish buys shock his wife. Plus, premium prices at an antique emporium in London cause trouble.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes on a Porsche 924, the first car he ever turned around on the series, but oil leaks and a worn interior may not be enough to earn a profit.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Arnold brings Dan two related projects. He wants the team to transform his 1946 Ford Wagon into a classic tour-mobile, and fix the motorcycle that will ride in the back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how sardines are fished and processed. Plus, the manufacture of ejector seats and Piaggio scooters.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.sub-title: Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins work on a 1972 Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 bought for 2,200, stripping it down for a re-spray.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.sub-title: Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000 - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer visits Edd China to see how work is progressing on the 1972 Alfa Romeo Spider Veloce 2000, and finds out how much its value has risen by.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers try to mislead detectives by making a murder look like suicide, and the role of forensics in establishing the truth.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case from 2014, when Kimberly Robertson's battered body is found on a pavement after a date with her boyfriend. CCTV footage was called upon to help police identify her killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate when an armoured car robbery leaves three guards dead and another critically wounded, and it soon emerges heavily armed terrorists are to blame.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators are called out after disturbing reports of a large number of dogs held captive in makeshift pens. Octavio Gonzales receives a call about an abandoned horse.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown goes on a dangerous mission to capture a monster python called Big Mamma.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A shih tzu needs an urgent transfusion when she begins bleeding from her bowel.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: The Devil Is in the Details
programme.desc: Niche wants a fashionable gown but her mother prefers the traditional look, while a bride with a specific style in mind struggles to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A visitor to the shop is on the verge of a panic attack, and a bride needs to find a dress that all her university friends can agree on.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer wants to look like Cinderella and get married at Disneyland, and a bride buys a dress, but then worries she has made the wrong choice.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to understand what has happened to a shih tzu cross after it was found to be bleeding internally while being groomed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to save Jonti the cat, which has suffered a gaping neck wound after playing with the family dog.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Agents recall memorable cases, including the seizure of more than 30 poodles, 200 chickens being kept in inhumane temperatures exceeding 100 degrees and a house overrun by 50 rabbits.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen saves 37 dogs from a fire, and rescue technician Roman Leal searches a drain for some stranded puppies.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators assess conflicting accounts of an office party that took a violent turn and left one woman injured.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of TV news presenter Jodi Huisentruit, who went missing in June 1995. Outside her home in Iowa, officers found evidence of a struggle near her car, with some of her personal items - including her keys - found strewn in the vicinity.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 51-year-old park ranger James Morgenson, who vanished while on duty in July 1996. His remains were found nearly five years later when it was surmised he had fallen through a snow drift, dying of associated injuries and hypothermia. His remains were washed down a creek and into a small cascade where they remained hidden for some time.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: A 1985 case in which 23-year-old Linda Brown was shot dead in her bedroom. Fourteen-year-old step-daughter Cinnamon Brown initially confessed to the killing, but later declared the slaying had been set up by her father David, who had collected $835,000 on a life insurance policy.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be who has planned a fairy-themed wedding hopes to find a dress to match. Plus, Vicki returns for a fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: All brides have a tight budget, forcing some to haggle for even more bang for their buck. It remains to be seen whether everyone will be able to secure their dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah becomes engaged and looks for a dress of her own, while Sola searches for a gown that will reflect her culture.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel is assigned to help a bride-to-be who is preparing a military wedding, but Randy steps in instead. Plus, a client searches for a dress to renew her vows in.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah, a former model, is assigned to consultant Dianne, who is challenged by her opinionated maid-of-honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Debbie and Carmel team up to sell dresses to sister brides, but one of them would rather work alone.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Edinburgh collectors visit a market in Valbonne on the Cote d'Azur, buying items which they take back home and spruce up in a bid to make the most profit. Marika uses spray paint to turn a glass porthole into a mirror, Tom does the least amount of upcycling possible, and retro queen Sally has a good tip for restoring vinyl furniture.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry from Cashbrokers in Penzance goes to look at some antique petrol pumps, while in south-east London childhood sweethearts want to pawn their jewellery to fund a family reunion.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Diana is a prisoner to her 620lb-body. Desperate to break free of her food addiction, she embarks on a weight loss journey, hoping to keep her food addiction in check, in order to regain control of her life.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Profile of Moors murderer Myra Hindley who, along with her partner Ian Brady, abducted and killed five children during the 1960s. Featuring contributions from the relatives of her victims as well as criminal psychologists, who discuss whether she was innately evil or an impressionable woman under the power of a perverted man.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: On Valentines' Day 2007, police in Southern California were called to a particularly violent murder scene. Advances in forensic genealogy finally solved the case.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The case of Dean Fawcett. Weeks after the Christmas disappearance of the 22-year-old, detectives found a headless body in the snow. A handwritten note pointed to a dangerous set of suspects, setting Illinois investigators on a cross-country manhunt to unravel the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How science is helping police establish links between contract killers and their employers.
